title.rendered: Energy Global Winter Issue 2020 publishes article by OWC

content.rendered:
OWC’s APAC director Tom Whittle and Cables expert Daniele Caruso jointly tackle floating wind in the Winter 2020 edition of the Energy Global magazine. They reiterate what key players in the offshore wind market have known for some time now: that floating is here to stay. 

Their article, entitled It’s Time to Supersize, looks into how floating offshore wind projects are expected to benefit from the realisation of the cost reduction opportunities that novel floating wind-specific designs can bring. The two experts discuss market trends, different floating wind platform designs, and predicted challenges for cables and floating offshore wind in the present and future in an article that will be of interest to offshore wind developers and investors globally.

To access the full publication, please click here. For more news and publications, please visit Energy Global’s website.

OWC is an independent consultancy offering project development services, owner’s engineering and technical due diligence to the offshore renewables sector. The company is the renewables unit of Oslo-listed AqualisBraemar ASA.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC appoints head of Asia Pacific region
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following a substantial regional expansion in Asia over recent years, international offshore wind consultancy firm OWC has appointed Tom Whittle to its newly created role of Asia Pacific regional director. In 2018, OWC opened its first Asia Pacific office in Taiwan. Today, the company also has offices in South Korea…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC expands offshore wind offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Renewables consultancy firm OWC sets up its own energy yield assessment service capability for offshore wind projects, providing an additional integrated service offering to developers.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC to support Erebus floating wind farm
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has entered into a contract to provide engineering services for Simply Blue Energy and Total’s Erebus floating wind project located in the Celtic Sea offshore Wales, UK.

jetpack-related-posts.title: South Korea next for OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has decided to set up an office in South Korea in order to support the country’s ambitious offshore wind plans. Industry senior NJ Park has been appointed OWC’s country manager.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC tasked with floating wind technology review
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC closely follows the development of around 40 technology solutions for floating wind platforms. Under this contract, OWC will assess the technology readiness level of each.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC ramps up major wind project offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has appointed Scott Sutherland to the newly created role of director of major projects, in charge of growing the company’s project management services for fixed and floating wind projects.
